quote: Hearts Live By Being Wounded
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Good heart, good soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Heart My heart jumps every time you walk through the door.It's not love.I have an arrhythmia.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Hearts set about finding other hearts the moment they are born, and between them, they weave nets so frightfully strong and tight that you end up bound forever in hopeless knots, even to the shadow of a beast you knew and loved long ago.
author: Catherynne M. Valente,  The Girl Who Fell Beneath Fairyland and Led the Revels There

quote: The heart is man’s treasure, and that’s why it’s locked in a cage of ribs with only one key. The key isn’t metal or material—it’s the feeling of love.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: Love with all your heart. And the rest of your body. Oh, and your mind, too.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: My heart hurts that means I’m alive.
author: Kazuya Minekura,  Stigma

quote: The heart was made to be broken.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The heart of a person only beats when it's surrounded by blood, by family.
author: Erica Goros,  The Daisy Chain

quote: The heart is the toughest part of the body. Tenderness is in the hands.
author: Carolyn Forché,  The Country Between Us

quote: The Heart wants what it wants - or else it does not care
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: A heart has problems which mind cannot understand.
author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday

quote: An empowered heart is one filled with self love.
author: Amy Leigh Mercree

quote: Profound joy of the heart is like a magnet that indicates the path of life.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: This heart belongs to you alone.
author: Skillet,  Awake

quote: My heart only grows more powerful the more my flowing love goes unabsorbed, unobserved, and unappreciated.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: My heart is locked away in a cage surrounded by ribs. That’s to protect it, and to keep the world safe. It’s currently serving a life sentence.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: Heartbreak [10w] Heartbreak’s like a heart attack but without the hospital bills.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: It's such a silly little thing, the heart.
author: Ned Vizzini,  It's Kind of a Funny Story

quote: Even death has a heart.
author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

quote: Hearts Hearts of hope and of promiseHearts filled with dreams and whim,These are the hearts of loversUnguarded,Standing out on a limb.Hearts unmended and brokenHearts scarred to stone and steel,These are the hearts of loversArmored,Being unable to feel.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: What does the brain matter compared with the heart?
author: Virginia Woolf,  Mrs. Dalloway

quote: Love with passion. Love for no reason.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The heart has its reasons but the mind makes the excuses.
author: Amit Abraham

quote: Purity of heart is what enables us to see.
author: Pope Benedict XVI,  Jesus of Nazareth: From the Baptism in the Jordan to the Transfiguration

quote: You are my heart as it beats within my chest, my soul as it moves through my mind. The breath in my body that so fascinates you is your essence pouring in and out of me in a wave that drowns me over and over again until I cannot breathe for wanting you. Needing you.
author: Jacquelyn Frank,  Elijah

quote: The ear is the avenue to the heart.
author: Voltaire

quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Heart-flow means listening to your intuition and hunches and following your heart. How can you let your heart lead today?
author: Amy Leigh Mercree

quote: One love, one heart, one destiny.
author: Bob Marley

quote: All my life, my heart has yearned for a thing I cannot name.
author: Andre Breton

quote: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.
author: Jane Austen

quote: This is what comes of having a heart, even a very small and young one. It causes no end of trouble, and that’s the truth.
author: Catherynne M. Valente,  The Girl Who Fell Beneath Fairyland and Led the Revels There

quote: Sometimes the heart sees what is invisible to the eye.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote: Hearts may break, but hearts are the toughest of muscles, able to pump for a lifetime, seventy times a minute, and scarcely falter along the way. Even dreams, the most delicate and intangible of things, can prove remarkably difficult to kill.
author: Neil Gaiman,  Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders

quote: Let's see if I can write about something other than my heart.
author: Gary Shteyngart,  Super Sad True Love Story

quote: Every heart has a unique story to tell. We just need a mind to listen.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The heart is an arrow. It demands aim to land true.
author: Leigh Bardugo,  Six of Crows

quote: ♥ Love ♡ My heart skips a beat every time you walk through the door!It isn't love ~ I have an arrhythmia.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Our hearts have been made for you, O God, and they shall never rest until they rest in you.
author: Augustine of Hippo

quote: My heart is afraid that it will have to suffer.
author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

quote: To live in hearts we leave behind is not to die.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: The mind knows only what lies near the heart.
author: Edith Hamilton,  Mythology: Timeless Tales of Gods and Heroes

quote: There could have been no two hearts so open, no tastes so similar, no feelings so in unison
author: Jane Austen,  Persuasion

quote: To feel the joy of life, smile with love.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: A gentle heart is tied with an easy thread.
author: George Herbert

quote: Mind of a loving heart is the fountain of knowledge.
author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: My heart knows what my mind only think it knows.
author: Noah Benshea,  Jacob the Baker: Gentle Wisdom For a Complicated World

quote: Holding this soft, small living creature in my lap this way, though, and seeing how it slept with complete trust in me, I felt a warm rush in my chest. I put my hand on the cat's chest and felt his heart beating. The pulse was faint and fast, but his heart, like mine, was ticking off the time allotted to his small body with all the restless earnestness of my own.
author: Haruki Murakami,  The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
